intro: Calyptrocalyx arfakianus, commonly known as the Arfak mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Indonesia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, large, showy flowers. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces fruits that are capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
